pullRequest.body:
We prove  lower bounds for the abs. value of the discriminant of a number field in terms of its degree and deduce from it Hermite-Minkowski theorem: a nontrivial number field has nontrivial absolute discriminant. 

```lean
theorem abs_discr_ge (h : 1 < finrank ℚ K) :
    (4 / 9 : ℝ) * (3 * π / 4) ^ finrank ℚ K ≤ |discr K| 

theorem discr_gt_one (h : 1 < finrank ℚ K) : 2 < |discr K|
```

---

-->

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#8030~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#8481~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> I am just a little bit worried about the various `open Classical` (I fear they can create diamonds if `K = ℚ`). I guess that everything comes from `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Embeddings`. Tagging @eric-wieser as an expert in this kind of stuff.

Could you point out where you think such a diamond might appear? I'm happy to investigate, but it would be easier for me if I knew where things looked questionable to you!

I had a quick go at removing `Classical` from this file; it seems this would require adding
```
variable [DecidablePred (IsReal (K := K))] [DecidablePred (IsComplex (K := K))]
```
and `DecidableEq (InfinitePlace K)` in a few places; though it's not obvious to me whether that makes any sense.

> I had a quick go at removing `Classical` from this file; it seems this would require adding
> 
> ```
> variable [DecidablePred (IsReal (K := K))] [DecidablePred (IsComplex (K := K))]
> ```
> 
> and `DecidableEq (InfinitePlace K)` in a few places; though it's not obvious to me whether that makes any sense.

OK, these will probably not make any sense without computable reals, so we are safe.
I guess that most of them come from something being a `Fintype`, so maybe `Finite` would work, but I guess that taking sums will not very fun.

Wonderful!

Thanks!

bors d+
Wonderful!

LGTM, thanks!

I am just a little bit worried about the various `open Classical` (I fear they can create diamonds if `K = ℚ`). I guess that everything comes from `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Embeddings`. Tagging @eric-wieser as an expert in this kind of stuff.

Thanks!

bors d+

```suggestion
    (4 / 9 : ℝ) * (3 * π / 4) ^ finrank ℚ K ≤ |discr K| := by
```
(untested)
Yes, that works, thanks! I tried some other combinations that resulted in having some ↑ here and there, but this works fine.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion · exact ENNReal.inv_ne_zero.mpr (nat_ne_top _) ```

```suggestion
open MeasureTheory MeasureTheory.Measure Real in
theorem convexBodySum_volume :
```
If those are used only in this theorem.

```suggestion
theorem convexBodySum_volume_eq_zero_of_le_zero {B} (hB : B ≤ 0) : volume (convexBodySum K B) = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
theorem convexBodySum_symmetric {x : E K} (hx : x ∈ (convexBodySum K B)) :
```
Here `K` can be implicit, but as you prefer.
Same here.

variable [DecidablePred (IsReal (K := K))] [DecidablePred (IsComplex (K := K))]
